title: Apply focused UI color theme update (background, cards, headings, buttons)

requirements.text: Update the global light theme color tokens so the app uses: main background #D6F0FF, cards/sections #FFFFFF, primary headings #2B2B2B, and primary buttons #FFE066 with dark text, without changing any app behavior or CRUD flows.

quotes:
Please make my background : #D6F0FF (light blue)

Sections/cards: #FFFFFF

Primary headings: #2B2B2B

Buttons: #FFE066 (yellow) with dark text

acceptanceCriteria: In light mode, the page background renders as hex #D6F0FF (or visually indistinguishable from it) wherever the app uses the global background token (e.g., Tailwind class bg-background).
In light mode, card/section surfaces render as #FFFFFF wherever the app uses the card token (e.g., bg-card).
Primary heading text (e.g., h1/h2/h3 or the appâ€™s main page titles) renders as #2B2B2B by default unless a specific component intentionally overrides it.
Primary buttons render with background #FFE066 and a dark, readable text color (e.g., #2B2B2B or equivalently dark).
No backend canister methods, data types, or CRUD behaviors are modified.

requirements.text: Keep changes focused to styling only: do not refactor components, routes, queries, or state management; only adjust the minimum CSS/theme variables and any minimal, directly-related hardcoded color classes that prevent the new theme colors from applying.

quotes: Make focused changes only. Ensure no other features or CRUD is impacted.

acceptanceCriteria: Only styling/theme-related files (e.g., frontend/src/index.css and other CSS/theme configuration as strictly needed) are changed; no feature logic changes are introduced.
All existing pages and modules remain functional and visually coherent after the color update (no unreadable text on buttons or backgrounds).

constraints: Make focused styling changes only; do not impact any other features or any CRUD behavior.
Do not modify backend logic or storage.
Do not edit any files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only); compose existing components instead if needed.
nonGoals: Adding new features, pages, or UI components.
Changing dark mode theme behavior unless required to keep text/button contrast acceptable in light mode.
